title: Business burglaries reported in Belmont Cragin
text:
Police are warning businesses of burglaries over the past week in the Belmont Cragin neighborhood on the Northwest Side.
The burglaries occurred at 1:30 p.m. Sept. 27 in the 6100 block of West Grand Avenue and at 12:20 p.m. Oct. 4 in the 6300 block of West Grand Avenue, according to a community alert from Chicago Police.
In both incidents, three black teens entered the business, displayed a gun and demanded money from the cash register. In one case, the teens took items from people inside the business, police said.
The three suspects are described as 15-to-17-year-old, 5-foot-6, 150-pound black boys with black hair. Two of them wore black hooded sweatshirts, and one of them wore a gray sweatshirt.
Anyone with information about the robberies is asked to contact Area North Detectives at (312) 744-8273.
